{
  "reasoning": "Let's work this out in a step by step way to be sure we have the right answer. The image shows a bowl with a mixture of porridge or oatmeal with visible oats, chia seeds, and chocolate chips, along with a chunk of peanut butter on top. Beside the mixture, there is a serving of fresh berries, including raspberries and blueberries. Based on the visual cues, the portion of porridge seems to fill a medium-sized bowl, roughly 2/3 of its capacity, with visible volume underneath due to the thickness of the mixture. The amount of chocolate chips appears to be roughly a small handful (~15-20 g). The berries occupy a smaller part of the bowl, approximately 30-40 g, assuming typical berry sizes. Given the density of the oatmeal and the visual volume, I estimate the porridge weighs around 250 grams, considering the typical density and the size of the bowl. The peanut butter chunk looks approximately 15 g based on its size, but since it's an addition, we only estimate that for context, not part of the target food. Therefore, the main focus is the oatmeal with toppings and berries. Taking all visual cues into account, I estimate the weight of the oatmeal and toppings (excluding berries) to be approximately 250 grams.",
